communications.subject: South Carolina Public Records Law Request: SC food inspection request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

The total number of DHEC Retail Food Establishment Inspection Reports, including limited in scope reports during COVID-19, for Lower Richland High School, separated by year, from 2017 - 2022.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Lynne Perri

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Historic ShotSpotter alerts
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records of the historic ShotSpotter alerts over time since the system was installed in 2021, in the format used by the department.

Please provide these in the format in which they are currently stored in your system, which may be a database, spreadsheet, CSV file, or similar.

If any part of this request is denied, please cite the relevant provisions in state law which justify the denial.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Josh Chamberlain

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Arrest records 2020–present
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A summary of arrests made between 1/1/20 to present, or stopping at 12/31/22. 

I'm not interested in individual arrest report documents, but a summary of all arrests during that period with as many details about the arrests as possible.

Please provide these in the format in which they are currently stored in your system, which may be a database, spreadsheet, CSV file, or similar.

If any part of this request is denied, please cite the relevant provisions in state law which justify the denial.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Josh Chamberlain
